citeinfo.title: Japanese Ocean Flux Data Sets with Use of Remote Sensing Observations (J-OFURO)

abstract.p:
Japanese Ocean Flux data sets with Use of Remote sensing Observations (J-OFURO). Ocean surface flux data sets were constructed mainly using satellite data and are as follows:
SWR: Shortwave Radiation (monthly)
LWR: Longwave Radiation (monthly)
LHF: Latent Heat Flux (monthly, 3days)
SHF: Sensible Heat Flux (monthly)
MF_E: Momentum Flux from ERS (monthly,10days)
MF_Q: Momentum Flux form QSCAT (monthly, Daily)
AIRT: Air Temperatre (monthly)
ALTI: Altimeter Product (cycle)

You can use the J-OFURO data freely for scientific use. If J-OFURO used in your publication or document, users are requested to reference the source of the data such as "J-OFURO data used in this study have been obtained from J-OFURO web site (http://dtsv.scc.u-tokai.ac.jp/j-ofuro/) and Kubota et al.,2002 (see following). Also we would appreciate your sending a reprint or copy of your publication or document to our address.
Kubota, M., N. Iwasaka, S. Kizu, M. Konda, and K. Kutsuwada, (2002): Japanese ocean flux data sets with use of remote sensing observations (J-OFURO). J Oceanogr, 58, 213-225.

descript.purpose: To derive homogenous data with high resolution using analysis and satellite data for obtaining globally-covered fluxes between ocean and atmosphere.
